intro: Elcaja roka, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the United States. It belongs to the genus Tithonia in the family Asteraceae, and is characterized by its bright orange to red flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disk florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elcaja roka is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
